website_summaries.verdict: French press fans love this highly-ranked sleek and shiny stainless steel model that's not only durable, but also produces a superior cup of coffee.
pros: Easy to clean, and all parts dishwasher safe
Insulated walls keep coffee hotter for a longer period of time than a glass French press – and there’s never any breakage
Filters keep out more grounds than other similarly-priced presses
can also use to make loose-leaf tea
cons: Will only make a couple of cups at a time
Users would like to see markings to indicate water levels

customer_reviews.title: Don't be fooled by all the 5 star reviews
customer_reviews.text: Products like this are frustrating b/c of all the 5 star reviews. Cheaply made, the screen was coming apart right out of the box, the lid doesn't seal (as mentioned in other negative reviews), stainless steel is magnetic, no way it keeps coffee hot for any appreciable amount of time. Mine was cold by the time i got out of the shower (~20 mins after making it)... all-in-all really cheaply made and disappointing. Save your money on a name-brand.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Great Deal for The Money
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I've broken several glass coffee presses. I've had this for several months and use it once, maybe twice, a day. The screen is easy to clean and the finish looks just like it did when I first got it. For the price, this is a great deal UPDATE I bought this near the beginning of 2017. Used 2-3x a day. The joint between the rod and the filter failed 12/06/17. Usually these fail because the rod becomes unscrewed from the rod assembly- this was not the case.The entire filter assembly fell off the rod and the rod assembly. Needs to be re-welded. Bought a second one.
customer_reviews.author: Matt253545

customer_reviews.title: I am so disappointed. How in the world did it get so ...
customer_reviews.text: Oh noooo. It has to go back. It came today, I washed it by hand, and the top fell off. It is not a screw on, probably welded on (poorly). I am so disappointed. How in the world did it get so many 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Helen

customer_reviews.title: The bottoms is too floppy to be useable
customer_reviews.text: I have had this French press for 5 weeks and I like it: it keeps coffee warm for refills, it holds a lot, and looks nice in our kitchen. However, the screw became loose from the bottom piece so now in order to disassemble it, I have to use pliers... I will probably still use it, I just expected more. Update: with the bottom part all floppy, it doesn’t keep the coffee grounds out of my coffee. It is what I consider unuseable.
customer_reviews.author: Shye Marshall

customer_reviews.title: Makes an excellent cup of coffee.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great coffee press. Makes a great cup of coffee, can't praise it enough. I liked mine so much I bought my daughter one too. It's very durable and cleans easily; I've had mine for about a year and not a single stain even after leaving the grounds in for the day. I like a strong cup of coffee and use 6 measures (scoop from drip coffee maker) of coffee. Heat the water to about 205 degrees. Stir the coffee following the pour. Let it steep with the lid on (don't press yet). Then press at constant, easy does it, rate. Serve.
customer_reviews.author: Charles R McDonald

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Product isn't very well made - handle fell off almost immediately
customer_reviews.author: jbbsac

customer_reviews.title: Broke after two weeks of use.
customer_reviews.text: The product looks great and keeps the coffee warm as advertised, however, one of the filter pieces broke after just two weeks of use. I was the only one to use it and was careful with it and followed all instructions. The piece that had the screw to hold all the filters together disconnected from the screw. I can no longer take it apart to clean it or to replace the screen when it needs it because there is no way to unscrew it. Unfortunately, I missed the Amazon return window because it was a busy time for me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful, shiny, sturdy, great customer service.The sleeve on the filter assembly is used to keep the filters at the bottom of pot.I had the pot for close to a year and the sleeve came off the filter assembly stick. I called Secura, they emailed me requesting a picture of the filter assembly and then they mailed me a new pot. Fast efficient and painless. Done during Thanksgiving weekend - great customer service.Although the filter assembly broke, I still think that the painless resolution to this problem deserves to be noted and I still belie that the product is well-made.
customer_reviews.author: golitely

customer_reviews.title: Handle broke upon first use.
customer_reviews.text: Upon filling for the first time, the handle broke off. Upon inspection, you can still see the machine edge of where the handle was supposed to be affixed to the body. Poor Welding. I am hopeful that this was just an unlucky order. Will try to order again after looking at reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: I like the coffee it makes
customer_reviews.text: I like the coffee it makes, but it broke after seven months. The threads in the part that screws onto the plunger handle are apparently threaded into some pretty soft metal and they just started 'wobbling out' until there were no more threads and the plunger handle couldn't be screwed in again. The worst part is that there is no warranty on it that I can find. Oh well, I got a few months out of it i guess. I won't be buying again from this seller (Lafraise) or this manufacturer (Secura).
customer_reviews.author: Adam David

customer_reviews.title: Oddly enough, the top does not fit snugly into ...
customer_reviews.text: Oddly enough, the top does not fit snugly into the carafe, but has almost 1/2" sideways play, quite sloppy. Also, there is no indication on the top as to where the spout bevel is, takes guesswork to line it up with the spout on the carafe. These are careless oversights in the design of the unit, both of which could pose a burn/scald hazard. Sure wish I bought the similar but cheaper press.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas J. Farruggella

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Junk. Stripped screws. Easily falls apart with pressure and can't fix it. Unfortunately I am a busy mom and missed the deadline to return it. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Peters

customer_reviews.title: Not too happy with this press
customer_reviews.text: Not too happy with this press. Make sure you clean thoroughly. Someone thought it was a good idea to grease the screw threads. I'm a bit concerned that my first few cups of coffee had been contaminated upon discovering this.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: NOT shiny as advertised!
customer_reviews.text: I expected shiny French press coffee as advertised on picture of the product, but no it's not shiny at all... Welding is lousy made too... Overall is product OK, besides mentioned disappointment
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Larsen

customer_reviews.title: I love the coffee the French press
customer_reviews.text: I love the coffee the French press, makes the best, coffee, and its smart looking ,the reason for the 4 stars instead of 5 is ,according to the directions ,you can't leave anything wet in it ,or it will rust, so I feel compelled to clean quickly after I make coffee, which kind of spoils the whole coffee experience before I leave for work in the morning,
customer_reviews.author: The Goddess

customer_reviews.title: Metallic flavor that ruins the coffee experience
customer_reviews.text: I tried everything to get the horrible metallic taste from the coffer. After repeated hand washings and several times through the dishwasher the bad taste remains. I dont know how it gets all of the high ratings. I thought a best seller would deliver good coffee. Not so.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Evan Walker

customer_reviews.title: Stripped Screw
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this French Press on 2/24/2019 and three months later the screw that holds the plunger together became stripped and I can no longer use this press effectively as it comes apart inside the cylinder when I make coffee. Update: I finally threw this out today as the screw is totally stripped. BTW I did try my best to be careful not to over tighten the screw as before I bought it I read a review warning of this but it stripped anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Arrived with broken handle
customer_reviews.text: Just received today. Handle broken off body of item. Appears it may have been a welding failure after manufacture. Shipping box and product box undamaged. Willing to try one more to see if it arrives undamaged in time for brunch Sunday.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Super disappointed. Just 4 months after purchase the filtering ...
customer_reviews.text: Super disappointed. Just 4 months after purchase the filtering part of the french press does not work and does not filter
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Alipio

customer_reviews.title: A Deliciou Cup of Coffee
customer_reviews.text: Well, the advertisement on Amazon made a point about no sediment in the coffee. I use two filter screens with the French Press, and still get a little sediment at the bottom of the cup. I use a Burr grinder (hand operated) which is effective in producing a coarse output. Still, sediment. I give it a four star rating instead of five only because the product description made a point about no sediment. French Press coffee is delicious and I would buy this press again without hesitation.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Excellent coffee press at a good price!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this for about a month so far, and couldn't be happier with this french press. The construction is solid, with no visible seams or flaws that I could find. The double-wall stainless keeps the coffee inside hot, and is easy to clean. The outside of the press is only slightly warm, and comfortable to hold. Unlike the glass presses, I don't feel worried all the time about breaking the press while cleaning. Mine came with one screen installed, with two extra screens included. I'm currently using all 3 screens at once, and have a clean cup of coffee every time. I would definitely buy this again if needed, or recommend it to friends
customer_reviews.author: mostlyharmlessx

customer_reviews.title: Hot Coffee
customer_reviews.text: This is a great French Press, the discourse between glass and stainless steel brew quality can be made. I feel the benefit of the stainless steel makes any quality lost worth it. Personally I do not think there is much if any lost brew quality, but some people do. #1. Coffee keeps hot for much much longer than it will in glass #2 You can heat and cool this forever, drop it, wash it and never break it. I have had at least a half dozen glass presses meet their demise in relatively short order. For one or two people it brews enough for one large cup or two small cups each. Nice Press well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: traveling_tlc

customer_reviews.title: Is ok, shop for something else
customer_reviews.text: After a few months of using this, the parts that hold on the filter simply do not come apart. Coffee grinds will forever be trapped in the filter. Also, the thing itself doesn't have any kind of volume markings, making it difficult to know how much water you're putting in. It looks nice but if I can't clean the filter, it's useless.
customer_reviews.author: Ana

customer_reviews.title: Hands Down!! The Best French Press, you will not be disappointed, QUALITY A+++
customer_reviews.text: OMG, I cannot tell you how in love i am with this Secura Stainless Steel French Press Coffee Maker. I have been doing my research, and to have something like this is a Dream..... The quality is A+++ .. Stainless Steel and heavy. Without a doubt, this will keep my coffee hot and i am so excited to use this. You WILL NOT BE DISAPPOINTED!!! Promise..
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Poorly Made
customer_reviews.text: The first several uses were really good. However, a week later the filter assembly fell apart. There is no pressure when pressing the handle down, which results in a huge mess and unfiltered coffee. It's an expensive piece of trash or I would have thrown it away. I like the modern simplistic design and stainless steel body but it doesn't justify the mess it makes. I'm forced to go back to a traditional glass beaker french press.
customer_reviews.author: goglobal

customer_reviews.title: I have been really happy with it until I wanted to clean it
customer_reviews.text: I have been really happy with it until I wanted to replace the filter. I cannot get the screw to release next to the filter to replace or clean it. No way no how, it's not coming apart. I really do not want to buy another one, so far a waste of money. :(
customer_reviews.author: J. J. Brewer

customer_reviews.title: Better than a coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: This product is pretty great especially for the price. I had bought the smaller size press previously but we needed more coffee when my husband started law school so we increased the size . Pros: Makes good coffee, decent price, better than a full on coffee maker and doesn’t take up much space. Con: My only con is it could be easier to clean. Sometimes the strainer takes longer than I’d prefer to clean. However, the main part and stainless steel is super easy to clean it’s just the filter that isn’t.
customer_reviews.author: hannah

customer_reviews.title: Like the french press
customer_reviews.text: Like the french press. You need to be careful when you place the plunger into the carafe, or you'll end up with hot water all over the place (If it isn't set exactly, it "sticks" and you end up with a mess). But other than that, I like it. It's easy to clean and it's a relief not having to worry about someone banging it and breaking it (that's what happened to my old press).
customer_reviews.author: shamangrrl

customer_reviews.title: Great capacity French press.
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy build, good capacity...50 ounces, I can make 40 ounces cold brew coffee at a time. You definitely need to disassemble the press screen after each use as some grounds become lodged between the two metal plates and the mesh screen, this is easy to do, normal cleaning won't dislodge them! Really satisfied with this product.
customer_reviews.author: David Ess

customer_reviews.title: Good price for Value - Sturdy unit
customer_reviews.text: Modern sleek design - I really like stainless steel so it works for me The handle is great, good for someone with large hands & very sturdy. Good price I'm rating it a 4, given its design flaws, as I think a few improvements could be made. There are no markings on the interior for the water level, so you don't know how much water you've put in. The top also does not have any markings, so you don't know if you're in pour mode or not
customer_reviews.author: LisaM

customer_reviews.title: I Don't Even Like Coffee
customer_reviews.text: Okay, this might sound weird, but I don't like coffee. However, I do have guests over who drink the bitter liquid and thought it best to have something to make it without taking up valuable counter space. I've since used it nearly ever other weekend and even I have to admit the coffee that comes out of it is okay (I still prefer my tea though). A suggestion for the beginner, look up how to properly brew coffee in a French press before testing it, if not, the first results can be a disaster but that's what you get when the person brewing coffee prefers tea over the bitter liquid and wings it.
customer_reviews.author: D. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Handle broke off completely when dropped once
customer_reviews.text: No assembly was needed on purchase to make the product usable. I was very happy with this product when I first got it and I used it on average every other day for almost a year. Then I dropped the main body of the beautiful stainless steel French Press just after washing it and the handle completely broke off. The handle was not attached well at all. I was hoping to see a screw that I could use and put the handle back on. There isn't any way to reattach it. It appears to be a design flaw. The handle had very little contact with the body of the coffee maker.
customer_reviews.author: Kitty

customer_reviews.title: Not a good product
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought a different french press from another company as it looked nicer but ended up returning it as it was not functional. So I went with this one as it had the best reviews. I was very disappointed upon receiving it. It honestly looks a bit cheap, although seems like a decently sturdy material. However I was sent a product with an obviously crooked knob which makes it look even worse. The product was packaged well so it is clear it was like this before being shipped.
customer_reviews.author: Essi

customer_reviews.title: I received a defective unit.
customer_reviews.text: When I received this SECURA coffee press ,5 days ago ,I was very happy. It looks nice ,quality stainless steel ,good price with an extra screen .It's easy to use and easy to clean. But 4 days later ,with some good brew of coffee and 4 times of hand washing ,the handle were broken off ! I think this is a defective unit. I'm 73 years old ,with a severe hearing loss ,that' s a hassle to go to post office to return it. I will be very pleased if I receive a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: DANH HUU NGUYEN

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful and Durable French Press
customer_reviews.text: I have had several French Presses over the last 20 years including glass and another stainless steel one. If you are still using one of those glass and metal (or plastic) French Presses, give it away and buy this. It is vertually indestructable with little care around the plunger, keeps your coffee hot for an extended period and looks beautiful. I also think the price is fair and competive with the "cheaper" models.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee pot for the money
customer_reviews.text: Just started using this coffee pot. Its easy to use and clean. We liked the extra filters that were included. Its larger than we were expecting but dies not spill when pouring which is why we replaced our old french press. In fact being a little larger allows us both to have extra coffee which we like. It does get warm on the outside not not sure how long it holds heat for ( we’ve been using the coffee right away) we like the turn lid to pour feature that prevents spills. The price was great and we would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: CaptainKornchex

customer_reviews.title: Awesome French Press!!
customer_reviews.text: My ratio is 2 tbsp of 100% Kona Coffee Dark roast beans per 8oz of filtered water. I heat water with an electric kettle, then add fresh grounds and hot water to my French press. Let it brew for 4 min than press about 3-4 times. Pour into your cup and enjoy.
customer_reviews.author: KGEEZ

customer_reviews.title: Solid Construction, Beautiful, and KEEPS COFFEE HOT
customer_reviews.text: I was tired of breaking my glass French press coffee makers, so I thought I would give the Secura a try. I'm glad I did. This coffee press is double-walled and high-quality construction. It's also beautiful. I like that the company includes extra filters in case the stainless steel, reusable filter that it comes with ever needs replacing. Most important: It makes excellent coffee, and it keeps the coffee HOT. I highly recommend this French press, and I would also recommend it as a gift. It works and feels as though you spent MUCH more on it than you did, and it is sure to impress the recipient.
customer_reviews.author: L. Bernstein

customer_reviews.title: First time user and never going back !
customer_reviews.text: First time French press user. My husband and I love it !! The filter was a bit confusing because it comes apart by unscrewing two different ways. Wish there was an easier way. I buy Costco coffee and grind it there on first level of fine and I do not get any coffee grans in my coffee. Honestly all coffee Is inferior after this gem was found !! always clean and fully dry it to maintain it in top conditions. This is a size for two people max. If you’re a family go with the bigger one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So far it’s perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Have been using for about a week, this French press is fantastic so far. Coffee comes out great! The 50 oz is huge compared to my last one which will make it much easier when we have guests. This thing is solid! My husband had dropped (and shattered) the glass beaker of our last French press so I figured I’d give a metal one a try and hope it worked out, and I honestly think the coffee is better. The outside of the press stays cool enough to touch because of the design which could not be said of my last one. Hopefully it will last and stay in great condition. So far, I’m very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent french press and big improvement over my old glass model
customer_reviews.text: I broke my old glass french press when it had a collision with my granite countertop, so needed a replacement. The Secura French Press was a great upgrade. it is sturdy (and will not break), easy to clean, and the insulated press keeps my second cup warm so I no longer have to microwave my second cup. In addition, the extra screens are great, but not sure I'll use them because the edge design of the screen holder is much better than my old glass press, where the edges were often frayed. Overall great product, and am enjoying the press along with no longer dumping plastic pods in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: pisco sour

customer_reviews.title: Could've been less expensive
customer_reviews.text: Sort of expensive, main steel filter is losing it's form making it harder to assemble once washed and dried. Although if coffee is prepared right it keeps its smell and flavor which what I was after choosing this french press over traditional coffee machines
customer_reviews.author: Farkhod

customer_reviews.title: Does the job. OK for the price.
customer_reviews.text: First purchase of a french press so it seems OK. Construction is good so we'll see how it holds up. May revise the rating in a few months. Oh, and the touted free gift accompanying the order has never materialized. We sent in the request along with order number and feedback but a month later still nothing. Kind of leaves a bad impression for a company that does business like that. Bait and switch comes to mind.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa J

customer_reviews.title: Good Corona-quarantine companion
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as I broke the glass french press we had (Bodum I believe). Works great, came with replacement screens, keeps the coffee warm...and I've been using it daily for weeks now given the stay-at-home orders we have. Don't know why anyone would buy a glass one at this point...this is basically indestructible and I think the screen works better than our glass one at filtering.
customer_reviews.author: tallhapa

customer_reviews.title: Never should have purchased
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had never purchased this. The picture shows what happens way to frequently - when pressing, the dangerously hot liquid pops out. I’ve used many different types of coffee presses over the years and this one has a host of problems. Grounds ALWAYS end up in the coffee so I end up having to strain again. The wire part can be difficult to get truly clean. The only reason I gave it two stars is the stainless steel part so there is no risk of broken glass. I hardly ever write reviews so this shows how frustrated I am. Maybe I ended up with a defective one, but it is important to share these issues.
customer_reviews.author: K. Bizier

customer_reviews.title: ... only one that drinks coffee - I do not like the waste of the pod coffee makers
customer_reviews.text: I am the only one that drinks coffee - I do not like the waste of the pod coffee makers. I wanted something simple and eco-friendly and this has worked well. I purchased this French press after my glass one was damaged. This French press is easy to use, to clean and the insulated wall keeps the coffee warmer longer than the glass press. Mine came with extra screens and the assembly is easy to take apart and clean to remove any coffee build up. I have had this one for close than a year I love it. It looks as new as it did the first day I open the box .
customer_reviews.author: Pam

customer_reviews.title: Even happier than I thought I’d be.
customer_reviews.text: I actually use this to make iced tea. I brew the tea in the press and then add it to the plastic tea pitcher filled with ice so I keep the hot liquid away from the plastic. The large size is great for a 2 liter of iced tea. I also like that it’s insulated. My old glass press would be hot instantly. I can still touch the outside of this after it’s been warmed up by the hot water. It would also keep your coffee hot while you drink your first cup.
customer_reviews.author: Erica K

customer_reviews.title: Least favorite french press I have owned
customer_reviews.text: This is my fourth french press, and my first stainless steel one. I am very disappointed, as it seems cheaply made. The lid is not tight around the edges. The plunger slides down on its own, so I have to rest the entire lid at an angle while the grinds steep. Do yourself a favor and go with a traditional, name brand french press.
customer_reviews.author: Helloitslo

customer_reviews.title: Most impressive french press I've ever seen!
customer_reviews.text: My father had gone through multiple french presses that all cost him a pretty penny but were terribly built and continually broke on him for one reason or another.... but then we found this gem!! I compared numerous french presses on Amazon, read hundreds of reviews, looked at more photos than I can count and finally decided to give this one a try. I could not recommend it more!! It's incredibly durable, well made, heavy duty, easy to use, easy to clean, dishwasher safe, beautiful in design, exceptional in functionality, I could go on and on. Stop reading reviews and just buy this one! Most impressive french press I've ever seen!
customer_reviews.author: Ehimmelman

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this for over 6 months probably and it’s still fantastic. I love that it’s stainless steal and not glass, because I’ve read way too many things about glass French presses exploding and shattering. This definitely upped my coffee game. It’s kind of hard to clean if you don’t have a garbage disposal and can’t put the grounds down the drain, but I just fill it with a little water, swish it around, and pour the grounds in my trash. The handle doesn’t get hot, and I never get grounds in my coffee. I got rid of my drip coffee maker after falling in love with this. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Very nice product
customer_reviews.text: Well made well insulated. Good capacity. Upper lid fits well to Cup portion. Beautiful exterior finish. Inside is a little rough, lots of tooling ridges. It is probably to keep the tight fit. Love the product. Works well for cold brew, hot brew. Nothing flimsy not glass, polycarbonate to break or discoloration. Should of bought one long ago. Been thru so many others.
customer_reviews.author: firedude

customer_reviews.title: Glad I bought this
customer_reviews.text: I don't always go with Amazon suggestions for purchases. A lot of the time things are most popular because they're cheap. I try very hard to avoid cheap(quality). I was pleasantly surprised when this arrived. It weighed about three times what I expected. Stainless steel is not an expensive. They used a lot of it when they made this. It is solid decent quality I have used it everyday for months now and it has never let me down. It looks the same as the day I started using it. It cleans quickly and easily. What a great coffee press. I love it
customer_reviews.author: Woodbutcher

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality!!
customer_reviews.text: Honestly love this but I went to pour myself coffee for the day and the handle detached I use this every day and it hasn’t even last a year?!? What a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn C. A.

customer_reviews.title: No more broken glass!!
customer_reviews.text: I broke my glass coffee press and was determined that wasn’t ever going to happen to me again - no coffee, what??!!! This stainless steel pot is just perfect. It keeps the coffee warm for a longer period of time - I use a little hot water to “warm the pot” ( I am British after all!) before adding the coffee and hot water. Makes 2 big mugs of coffee - who messes with cups in the morning??!! And I have no fear of smashing it. Comes with a couple of extra mesh filters, always useful. I can hand wash or throw this in the dishwasher and it’s good to go. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: BritGirlUSA

customer_reviews.title: Your Favorite Coffee Made Perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a die hard Starbucks fan who has experienced coffee made by various machines and methods, and this French press gives a smooth sweet texture to dark roasts like Starbucks Italian Roast removing the bitter aftertaste one experiences with conventional metal or paper filter coffee makers. It keeps coffee warmer than a traditional glass French press, so there aren't any worries of accidental breakage. I highly recommend this, will be making a gift of it to others, and I will be drinking my coffee made this way from now on!
customer_reviews.author: CCrystals121Top Contributor: Star Wars

customer_reviews.title: Filters are garbage
customer_reviews.text: I got this to replace my glass French press because I broke it while cleaning it (whoopsie!) so a more sturdy one was much needed. It is sturdy but the filters are awful! I’ve never had so many coffee grinds in my coffee before and this is the 4th French press I’ve owned. I also don’t like that the lid is hollow and open and can easily get water/coffee inside of it. Doesn’t seem very sanitary to me at all.
customer_reviews.author: Hilary

customer_reviews.title: Stainless is the way to go !!
customer_reviews.text: I’m glad I did a little research before buying a French press and I also talked to my son who makes French press coffee every morning. The stainless Steel, insulated pot was the way to go . Very user friendly, comes with instructions that are easy to follow and is very easy to clean. It also keeps coffee warm for 30 minutes. I like my coffee HOT so I do microwave if necessary. I love the smoothness of the coffee and I recommend you do a bit of research on what taste your looking for but what ever the roast grind your own beans !! Awesome coffee experience!!
customer_reviews.author: Kiki

customer_reviews.title: Excellent press, well made, and keeps things hot!
customer_reviews.text: Very well made unit. I was wanting something to step my roasted cacao nibs in for my morning boost (minus the high caffeine) and this did the trick. Keeps the water hot/warm for hours and after 15-20 minutes steeping the press is easy to push down. Be sure to let the plant debris settle before trying to press or you could end up scalding yourself with hot water. Have a little patience and this is an excellent option to a coffee pot, which I found didn’t work to my liking for the roasted cacao. Now I can enjoy my morning pick me up. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Carlin

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee press!
customer_reviews.text: I only need to make coffee in the morning for myself so I don't need to 'brew a pot of coffee' I also like to grind my beans fresh. This coffee press is perfect for a big ole' cup (or 3 regular cups) of perfectly fresh pressed coffee! I let it steep for 4-5 mins, then press it. The insulated press keeps my coffee hot until I'm ready to pour it. It's very well made, easy to clean and it comes with extra screens for the press itself. I'm very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: DM

customer_reviews.title: This high quality French press has changed my life.
customer_reviews.text: I got this press by recommendation of my sister-in-law, and I couldn't be more thrilled. As someone with acid-reflux issues, having less acidic coffee is paramount, hence the French press. Following the very easy instructions to brew and press the coffee, I get exactly what I need: smooth, less acidic, great tasting coffee. I live in a smaller place, so the fact that I can get fantastic coffee without taking much counter space up is a HUGE plus. Step aside espresso maker, Nespresso, and drip Mr. Coffee -- y'all have been replaced forever.
customer_reviews.author: Camille Vernon

customer_reviews.title: Industrial, commercial kitchen strength meets modern look and class
customer_reviews.text: Industrial, commercial kitchen strength meets modern look and class. Keeps coffee hot during duration of drinking in the am and truly a superior brand/make. Pleased at the ease to clean, the extra replacement tools provided, and the twist off/on ease to clean middle filter. All stainless steel parts makes this a must have in every coffee lover's kitchen. I haven't used my 10 cup automatic since this arrived and the glass french press that was a pain to fully clean, that this replaced, is in a landfill where it belongs.
customer_reviews.author: Thetownhousegardener

customer_reviews.title: IMPRESSED
customer_reviews.text: Love this press! Seems well constructed. Simple. Insulated via dbl wall stainless steel. I LOVE the size! No more going through the process several times for multiple people to enjoy. One and done! Ok maybe 2. Lol! I couldn't believe it when I opened it up and there were 2 extra screens!! TWO!!! impressive!!! This company obviously cares about its product and its customers. I'd love to see other products from this US company! Gonna put this in my camper. Can't wait to use it again
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It works well
customer_reviews.text: This is my first french press so I can't compare with any other. This one works for me as it should. Am using 3 filters and I still get a small amount of grounds so I'm playing the the coffee grind. However, I don't mind a few grounds. I premeasure the water and boil in the microwave. I would prefer if measurements were indicated on the pot so a small rating ding. The coffee is great and hot. Update: Just noticed that paint is starting to flake off a little from bottom of pot. This is a charcoal gray pot and is hand washed.
customer_reviews.author: grandmapeg

customer_reviews.title: These are kinda crap now
customer_reviews.text: Bought same item a couple years ago- it was excellent and still is, but we wanted a second one so ordered the "same" thing They've very obviously changed suppliers or design since 2016- new one is lighter, the lid is flimsy and seals poorly compared to the older one, and the stainless finish was chipped/scratch/missing in several places around the top lip....overall very clearly much cheaper made than the first one we bought. Returned to Amazon and will have to find someone else who still makes them well.
customer_reviews.author: Ted H Krulik

customer_reviews.title: Quality and function of this coffee press at or above one at $150 cost
customer_reviews.text: This French press coffee pot is constructed like one that cost 4 times the price this sells for. The quality and function are excellent and you can tell it will last for years. The stainless steel used is excellent and the screening and plunger are high quality and work easily and effeciently. Very very little grounds come thru to your coffee. HIGHLY recommend this pot if you are looking for a French Press Coffee Maker of this size.
customer_reviews.author: RangerOne

customer_reviews.title: High end French Press Without a High End Price
customer_reviews.text: I was immediately impressed with the quality of this French Press as soon as I took it out of the box. Came with extra screens (always an afterthought) and simple instructions made for this non-barista. There are no annoying seams inside the press, making it easy to clean. The stainless steel construction give the press a nice appearance, cross between elegant and industrial. I may never again need a French press, unless I lose this one, it may outlive me. Highly recommend. Great value, great product.
customer_reviews.author: G. Howard

customer_reviews.title: Low grade metal leach lead taste into coffee
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two one for home one for office. Both I cleaned well several times in hot water prior to use. Perhaps no one else tastes it but there is a bad metallic taste akin to lead in the coffee. How is it possible that this has FULL five stars ? Amazon you need to look into this - seems like a scam. Returned mine.
customer_reviews.author: Ari

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: This french press as funny as it sounds has beat my expectations. Last week I accidentally dropped the glass french press that I owned for 3 years and had great success with. It wasn't until receiving and using this french press that I instantly recognized the inferiority of my previous purchase. Great craftsmanship, the color is perfect for our kitchen and it just feels and looks like a quality piece when displayed on our countertop. The filtration process works so much better than my previous press and comes with an extra mesh screens for when they wear down.
customer_reviews.author: WhiteTeeBHF

customer_reviews.title: Not durable
customer_reviews.text: I've had this French press for approximately six months, and the plunger has failed. The screw that attaches the disc to the post came unfixed and so the disc doesn't attach to the post properly. Disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Moonlight Reader

customer_reviews.title: Design flaws make this not recommended :(
customer_reviews.text: The screen and filters constantly fall off as there’s no nut or anything besides screw threading keeping it together. A few uses and it falls apart. Also the lid spins and even though you might align the arrow with the spout, it moves and you get side spillage. Annoying, wouldn’t recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: French Press Body Is Decent, Plunger Is Faulty And BAD Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: The french press body is decent and keeps coffee warm which is what stainless steel excels at, my issue (and many others) is with the plunger and the handle which are extremely flimsy and break easily. When I reached out to Secura's customer support email they informed me there is nothing they can do but tell me to buy another ENTIRE french press coffee maker when their plunger is faulty, they mention that the screw is "easy to strip" as well. Don't buy anything from Secura.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Mesh filter is too fine, do not buy this product!!
customer_reviews.text: I have owned many Bodum's and French Press coffee makers in my life and this one is unequivocally the worst. The filter is too fine, it only works properly if you go to the supermarket and grind the coffee there using the "Coarse" setting. I've been unable to recreate this type of grind at home. This means that IT NEVER WORKS. Coffee is always spilling or it doesn't come out if ground too fine. Clearly designed and built by a company that has never used it. PS the return window is closed but I would prefer my money back for this POS.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: So easy to use and makes great coffee
customer_reviews.text: I've been using the Chemex pour-over method to make coffee but wanted to eliminate the issue of paper filters. This French press coffee maker is so easy to use, After all the steps of Chemex, it's a joy just to grind the beans, put them in the French press, pour in the heated water, wait 4 minutes or so, gently press down the plunger and voila! Truly excellent coffee. I've used it to make just one cup, and two cups. Both are good. This was not the most expensive French press Amazon sells, but I can't imagine the pricier ones being any better. Plus, it's great to look at.
customer_reviews.author: Easy Writer

customer_reviews.title: So classy! So strong!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! I feel like a princess with this French press! I ordered it because I was afraid my glass one might break and I wanted a sturdier French press. When I say princess, I mean I just feel rich & lucky to have such a beautiful coffee press! I love how sturdy this is and how good the coffee comes out. I've only had the press a few days but I'll check back if it proves to not be as sturdy as I'd like!
customer_reviews.author: KathleenHemrichTop Contributor: Women's Fashion

customer_reviews.title: Very pretty
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this 8-cup stainless steel French press to replace a cheaper glass French press that broke soon after I bought it. This new item is much sturdier and pretty enough to display permanently on the counter. The stainless steel looks and feels like it is high quality and has a very nice finish.I especially appreciate that it came with two replacement filters, so I do not have to hunt down compatible replacements when the original wears out. It was shipped in very secure packaging and arrived in perfect condition.
customer_reviews.author: Christy

customer_reviews.title: Thermal carafe on a good press
customer_reviews.text: After breaking two beakers on my press through old people foolishness, this stainless vessel should take all my abuse. Solid construction and good thermal insulation. My only bitch is not being able to visually see the level in the pot as I consume the grind. Other than that, this is wonderful as it keeps the coffee hot for a long time and cleans up well or you can hide how dirty it is from guests as they can’t see into the process like they could with your old glass model. Comes with two screens and has a nice flat press handle instead of some angular arrowhead to impale your palm.
customer_reviews.author: MIKE

customer_reviews.title: Simple and well made coffee maker. Great!
customer_reviews.text: This French press type coffee maker is a very good deal and makes fabulous coffee. (Very important to me!) It cleans in a snap and the filter does as well. Not only that, friends and foes, it also leaves a very, limited amount of floating grounds in the coffee. The instructions are as precise as can be and only those need to be followed. You don't need to clean it during only certain moon phases or when your cat hates you. Fabulous coffee maker that makes my mornings worth getting up for. Nice and strong and you can adjust even THAT to your level of strength simply. Most definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: DAMANWHOCAN

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed.
customer_reviews.text: So far, I am very happy with the French press. It feels very sturdy. I followed the directions and made my first pot of coffee. It turned out simply perfect. Loved it. I currently have a pretty expensive Bonavita coffeemaker and I’m happy to say that this French press exceeded my expectations. Now I wish I had ordered the super big one because my husband is going to be stealing my coffee. It also looks very pretty. I only used the one strainer and it did a great job of straining the coffee grounds.
customer_reviews.author: M. Stone

customer_reviews.title: The best French Press I've ever used.
customer_reviews.text: I love this press. The stainless steel construction makes it very eye-catching AND easy to clean. Ususally, it's just rinse with hot water and done, but sometimes a sponge is required, with a smidgen of soap. The actual press part of this set is superb. Also easily cleaned, and it works sooooo well. I'm an old, retired, Marine, used to drinking coffee made with a heavily stained cup filled with plain hot water. Imagine how good the coffee in my French press tastes compared with that! Superb product, well built, attractive, and it works like a...well...um...a good Marine!!!!
customer_reviews.author: USMC ret

customer_reviews.title: We had to upsize!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Secura French press coffee maker we have purchased, the first being the 34-ounce stainless steel (Model SFP-34DS) and the new one being the 50-ounce stainless steel (Model SFP-50DS). We loved the first one so much that we were fighting over who got the third cup every day, so we got the larger model to end the argument (and save our marriage!). Love how the insulation keeps the coffee warm, and the replacement filters are great to have—although we’ve never needed them. Particularly like the new arrow on the lid to point to the spout for pouring. Great purchase. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Oregon Mom

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Coffee Press
customer_reviews.text: This is an outstanding press and great value. Heavy stainless steel it keeps the product hot for 45 minutes to an hour. The press comes with multiple screens and I use a dual screen to keep the fines out of the coffee. Sturdy construction all the way around including the plunger and screens. The press is easy to clean and looks sharp on any table or counter. I have had many coffee presses and I bought this one to replace my Bodum which I have used for many years. It's the best press I've ever owned for heat consistency and sturdiness.
customer_reviews.author: D. Phillips

customer_reviews.title: A solid buy
customer_reviews.text: Pros: -sturdy main unit, double walled steel keeps your coffee hot while brewing -better than the glass models I've had in every way -makes a killer cup if you get your grind & timing right (coarse grind, ~4 minutes with water fresh off the boil) -comes with an extra screen so you can throw one in the dishwasher -great price for a big French press Cons: -i thought it broke once, but a piece had just come unscrewed, so I guess no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: BeardedSkeptic

customer_reviews.title: Needed a bigger pot
customer_reviews.text: I actually havent used it yet, I purchased it for when I have company and need a bigger pot. I bought a Frieling French Press pot years ago and love it. Purchased this pot becuase the price was about $90 less then the larger Frieling pot. I am happy with it for the price, it isnt the same weight and the lid isnt as tight a fit as the Frieling pot but again for the money I suppose it will be fine. I will update my review after I used it a few times.
customer_reviews.author: jamesp717

customer_reviews.title: Best French press I've used!
customer_reviews.text: We have a couple French presses, but they are glass bodied and needed something for camping. I am completely impressed with the build quality and precision of the press screens etc. It presses smoothly and strains out more solids than the far more expensive Bodum I have. You can't see the darkness of the brew through the container so we just poured a sip to see when we liked it. Best French coffee press for the money I have ever tried!
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: BUY IT
customer_reviews.text: My husband has been wanting a French press for the longest time! I purchased this one as a Christmas present and it is amazing! SUCH great quality and very easy to clean. It’s very study and looks so classy. My husband loves that he can carry it around the house to keep refilling his cup, and it keeps his coffee hot for hours. The mesh part is very well made and as long as your using the right ground of coffee you don’t have to worry about any coming through. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Jasmine Dias

customer_reviews.title: Great French Press! Worth it!!
customer_reviews.text: There are so many reasons that this is my favorite French Press ever! It’s easy to clean, keeps coffee hot for hours, looks pretty, holds more coffee than most brands, and best of all... no glass to break!! Seriously, isn’t that the reason we all have to buy a new French Press every year? I cannot be just me. It’s a great product!
customer_reviews.author: Madison

customer_reviews.title: sister Loves it
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this french press for my sister, first time I bought her a glass one loves it Her daughter dropped it, was so upset, it was a $10 glass one. I told her not to worry Ill get you another one, this is a great for her with small kids durable. Makes a great coffee I don't use it I have a Keurig,Dont have time to wait for coffee . But this is a nice one if you keep dropping ur glass french press
customer_reviews.author: DIckHertz

customer_reviews.title: A winner in coffee presses
customer_reviews.text: This is about our 5th coffee press in 10 years. I think we finally found a winner! Everything that we had break on the others is made right on this one. The end if the handle screws on and off so it won't break off. There's no glass. It comes with extra screens! I don't think we'll need another one anytime soon (if ever again) but if we do, it'll be the same one!
customer_reviews.author: AKN

customer_reviews.title: THE BEST cup of coffee you will ever make at home!
customer_reviews.text: A friend had me try this for my coffee and I am hooked! Nice smooth strong cup of coffee with no bitterness. It is a little hard to push the plunger down when using all three screens, but stirring the coffee up before you push the plunger down helps with this. If you are not strong in the hands I wouldn’t recommend this for you, i.e. arthritis or whatever.
customer_reviews.author: Debra K. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Good, solid french press that keeps your coffee hot for a while
customer_reviews.text: After using glass french presses, and eventually chipping/breaking them, got this stainless steel one and have been loving it. Keeps the coffee hot for a while (maybe an hour, haven't measured) and warm for longer. Very easy to clean and seems quite durable, except for the exterior paint, but I don't really care about that. I got the yellow one because it was the cheapest at the time. If you're worried about looks, get the stainless steel option.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Not worthy of all the stars
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this product because of all the great reviews, but my experience did not live up to all those stars. I liked it when I first used it; however, the screen became warped (I only hand wash), which causes the plunger to not lie flat or stay upright. Thus, coffee grinds seep out into the water and pour into the coffee cup, along with the coffee. Purchased 3 months ago, Amazon has been kind enough to allow a refund. I will not be purchasing this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: Jo

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this French Press! Stainless steal is easy to clean and super durable! After having my glass French press for the second time, I decided to try this one and am so happy I did! No more replacing those glass ones. Also comes with two additional filters! I also love the huge size! Can brew 6 cups of coffee in this size. I have not had coffee sit very long in it so I am not sure how hot it keep the coffee. No complaints!
customer_reviews.author: Alysia McDonald

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: Love that it's all stainless steel. Holds heat for quite a while. Filters the coffee great so there are no grinds in the cup. We went from a drip coffee maker to this and there's less after taste with this than the coffee maker. A bit of a learning curve to use it since we've never used a French press before, but it's pretty easy once you read the directions and get the hang of it. Easy to clean and great quality too. Would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Stingel

customer_reviews.title: GREAT COFFEE MAKER
customer_reviews.text: MAN...THIS THING IS GREAT...MY BROTHER USED A DIFFERENT BRAND OF PRESS DURING HUNTING SEASON AND I FELL IN LOVE WITH EASE OF USE TO MAKE A GREAT CUP OF COFFEE...BEFORE I HAD A CUP OF HIS COFFEE ,I MADE INSTANT COFFEE...BOY, WHAT A DIFFERENCE THE PRESS MADE...NO MORE INSTANT COFFEE FOR ME...I USED MY SECURA PRESS THIS MORNING FOR THE FIRST TIME AND HAD THE BEST CUP OF COFFEE SINCE MY BROTHER USED HIS PRESS...TO SUM IT UP..I DO NOT SEE ANY NEGATIVE COMMENTS ON THIS PRODUCT...ONLY POSITIVE ...TRY ONE...YOU WILL LIKE IT.
customer_reviews.author: LARRY RYALS

customer_reviews.title: Good press coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: We had a lousy French press when our drop coffee maker quit. This is now our permanent back up. Coffee filtered well through double screeds as there's a spare, too. Once coffee is made, there's no need to decant the extra to an insulated container. Coffee was still acceptably warm for the second cup. I'd consider this rig for our camp kitchen, but it's a smidge heavy and takes more room with the fixed handle.
customer_reviews.author: S. Barrett

customer_reviews.title: High quality, zero waste
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the stainless steel Secura french press coffee maker to replace a glass french press that had broken. I had been replacing the glass french presses about once a year and was finally fed up - I wanted a product that wouldn't break from regular use! This stainless steel option is fantastic! I've been using it daily for almost 2 weeks, and it makes a great cup of coffee. NONE of the parts are plastic, they are ALL metal. So if you're looking to make eco-friendly consumer choices that involve less plastic and less waste in general, this is a terrific option.
customer_reviews.author: jrg

customer_reviews.title: This is an excellent french press!!!
customer_reviews.text: Stainless steel insulated that results in pleasantly hot coffee with good flavor. Cleans easily like new after each use. Design of press is appealing to the eye. The only drawback for me is that there are no markings on the inside for water levels leaving one to guesstimate if you have proportioned water to coffee grounds appropriately. I like to press anywhere from 2-4 cups but I have to guess at the amount of water to use. Initially I used a measuring cup but found this to be possibly dangerous with increased danger of burning myself with boiling water. Maybe this could be addressed in the next model update.
customer_reviews.author: Amalia L

customer_reviews.title: Keeps coffee warm without worries.
customer_reviews.text: We should have purchased a stainless steel coffee press earlier ... considering that we have purchased and shattered three glass coffee press before we did so. I got tired of cleaning broken glass and thought ... there has to be a press that is not made of glass. We got this because of the reviews ... and the fact that we weren't the only ones tired of broken glass coffee press. We love our purchase. It keeps the coffee warm (definitely longer than any glass coffee press we ever had) and is easy to wash (by hand or via dishwasher). The stainless steel does not appear to affect the taste of the coffee. We're just glad we made this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: WR Peyton

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Little French Press!
customer_reviews.text: I have now used this little French Press for one a year. I am just as pleased, if not MORE please than when I first got it! It is Wonderful French Press! Excellent quality. Just the right size for me. I bought the 17 oz. which is about what I like to drink in one sitting. I can also travel with it because it is stainless steel and won’t break in my suitcase. They give you extra filters too! I have used this little press for many months now and still LOVE it! It is easy to clean, and makes Excellent coffee! I would give it 6 stars out of 5 !
customer_reviews.author: Dr. SS

customer_reviews.title: My review for this small French Press coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: Well so far since I got it today I've made 2 cups of coffee. I used Illy coffee and used a 3 tablespoons coffee grounds to 1 cup hot water ratio per drinking cup. I must say the 2 cups of coffee tasted very nice..... seemed fully bodied with little or no bitterness. I just used the one screen that was already attached. I admit I will probably experiment more and may try a different brand too just to cheapen the cost per cup but may end up with Illy again. I am impressed for a simple gadget.
customer_reviews.author: doug

product_meta.title: Secura French Press Coffee Maker, 304 Grade Stainless Steel Insulated Coffee Press with 2 Extra Screens, 34oz (1 Litre), Silver
feature_bullets: Secura stainless steel French Press coffee maker is made from top quality 18/10 stainless steel, both the interior and exterior. It is made to outlast other coffee maker.
3-LAYERED STAINLESS STEEL FILTER STRUCTURE traps the smallest coffee grounds to produce an exceptional full-bodied flavor.
BONUS Stainless Steel Screen included with this French coffee press. Filter screen is easy to dissemble and clean. Stack one or more screens together gives your coffee espresso more refined taste.
This French press maker comes with Cool touch handle and knob for comfortable and safe pouring.
The capacity of Secura Stainless-steel French coffee press is 34 OUNCE/ 1000ML. All the parts of this French coffee maker are DISHWASHER SAFE.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.8 out of 5 stars13,039 ratings4.8 out of 5 stars
